description: This error occurs when the server cannot be reached.
solution: Check if the server is running and reachable.
causes: The server is down or not started.
Incorrect server address or port.
Firewall or network configuration blocking the connection.
examples: java.net.ConnectException: Connection refused: no further information
troubleshooting: Ensure the server is running and reachable.
Check firewall and port forwarding settings.
Verify the server IP and port in the client configuration.

description: The plugin '${plugin}' failed to load due to compatibility or configuration issues.
solution: Ensure the plugin '${plugin}' is compatible with your Minecraft version.
causes: Plugin version is outdated or incompatible.
Missing dependencies required by the plugin.
Plugin files are corrupted.
troubleshooting: Update the plugin to the latest version.
Check if all required dependencies are installed.
Re-download the plugin files and verify their integrity.

description: The ItemLocksFabric ItemLock is purely client-side and does not work on servers.
solution: Remove the ItemLocksFabric, ItemLock Mod from your server Mods folder.
causes: Remove the ItemLocksFabric, ItemLock Mod from your server Mods folder.
troubleshooting: Itemlock mod is client-side only and does not work on servers.
Remove from your server mods folder

description: The server has run out of memory.
solution: Upgrade the server's RAM or reduce the number of plugins or mods.
causes: High server load due to concurrent logins
Slow network response from the client
Improper server configuration for ${mod}
troubleshooting: Server: out of memory = true, you should upgrade your server's RAM, or reduce the number of plugins or mods.
Client-Side: In your modloader client, you can increase the amount of memory allocated to the game.

pattern: java\.lang\.ClassCastException: class (?<sourceClass>[a-zA-Z0-9.$_]+) cannot be cast to class (?<targetClass>[a-zA-Z0-9.$_]+)
description: An incompatible class cast was attempted.
solution: Check for plugin/mod compatibility or update your Java version.
causes: The source class (${sourceClass}) is not compatible with the target class (${targetClass}).
Incompatible Java version or mod/plugin configuration.
examples: java.lang.ClassCastException: class jdk.internal.loader.ClassLoaders$AppClassLoader cannot be cast to class java.net.URLClassLoader
troubleshooting: Verify that the mods/plugins being used are compatible with the server's Java version.
Update to a supported Java runtime version.
Ensure no conflicting class loaders are being used by mods/plugins.

If no file name eula.txt is found, create a new text file named eula.txt and add eula=true to the file, ans save it.

pattern: This crash report has been saved to:
description: The server generated a crash report.
solution: Check the crash report file for details.
causes: When a server Crash Report is generated, it is saved to the server's crash-reports folder. The file name will be in the format 'crash-YYYY-MM-DD_HH-MM-SS-server.txt'.
examples: // I just don't know what went wrong :(
Description: Exception in server tick loop
java.lang.NullPointerException: Exception in server tick loop
troubleshooting: When a server Crash Report is generated, it is saved to the server's crash-reports folder. The file name will be in the format 'crash-YYYY-MM-DD_HH-MM-SS-server.txt'.

pattern: Distant Horizons.*encountered an error during the sided_setup event phase
description: Error with the Distant Horizons mod during the sided setup event phase. The error occurs because a configGui instance is null, causing a NullPointerException. This results in a server startup failure.
solution: Ensure the Distant Horizons mod version is compatible with the server/forge version. Verify if the Distant Horizons mod requires additional libraries or dependencies not included in your modpack. Remove this mod to see if your server will boot.

troubleshooting: No examples given yet...

description: Multiple warnings indicate that Wilder Nature entity types (e.g., wildernature:raccoon) were not realized during the registry phase.
solution: Verify that the Wilder Nature mod is compatible with the current Forge and Minecraft versions. Ensure all dependencies for the Wilder Nature mod are present and up to date. Reset the modâ€™s configuration files in the config/ directory to their defaults. Temporarily disable other mods to test if conflicts prevent Wilder Nature from loading entities properly. Check for updates to Wilder Nature addressing this issue. Report this issue on the mod's support page or issue tracker.

pattern: java\.lang\.Error: ServerHangWatchdog detected that a single server tick took \d+\.\d+ seconds.*
description: The server detected a hang, where a single server tick took significantly longer than the expected maximum of 0.05 seconds. This indicates minor server lag.
solution: You can turn off watchdog by going to - YourServerFolder/server.properties - max-tick-time=-1 - Default is 60000

description: The ItemLocksFabric ItemLock is purely client-side and does not work on servers.

pattern: java\.lang\.RuntimeException: Tried to read NBT tag with too high complexity, depth > [0-9]+
description: A corrupted or excessively nested NBT structure is causing the save file or world data to be unreadable.
solution: Use an NBT editor (e.g., NBTExplorer) to identify and remove the problematic NBT data. Restore the world from a backup if available.
causes: A mod stored infinitely nested or malformed NBT data.
Corrupted world data due to a crash or forced shutdown.
Incompatible mods writing invalid NBT entries.
examples: java.lang.RuntimeException: Tried to read NBT tag with too high complexity, depth > 512
troubleshooting: Open the world files with NBTExplorer to locate and fix the offending data.
Temporarily remove recently added mods to isolate which one created the invalid data.
Restore from a known good backup of the world.

pattern: Can't keep up! Is the server overloaded\? Running [0-9]+ms or [0-9]+ ticks behind
description: The server is experiencing lag and cannot process ticks at the expected rate.
solution: Optimize server performance by allocating more RAM, reducing the number of mods/plugins, or upgrading hardware.
causes: Insufficient RAM or CPU resources.
Too many entities, mods, or complex redstone contraptions.
Heavy chunk loading or world generation.
examples: Can't keep up! Is the server overloaded? Running 2199ms or 43 ticks behind
troubleshooting: Allocate more RAM to the server.
Remove or limit heavy mods and resource-intensive builds.
Optimize server settings (e.g., view distance).
Check server hardware performance.

pattern: defineId called for: class net\.minecraft\.world\.entity\.TamableAnimal from interface dev\.muon\.medievalorigins\.entity\.IFollowingSummon
description: A mod-related warning indicating data ID definition for a tamable animal entity that follows a summon interface.
solution: Check if the Medieval Origins mod is up-to-date and compatible with the current Minecraft/Forge version. This is generally a harmless warning.
causes: The mod 'Medieval Origins' or a related entity mod may be registering entities in an unusual way.
examples: defineId called for: class net.minecraft.world.entity.TamableAnimal from interface dev.muon.medievalorigins.entity.IFollowingSummon
troubleshooting: Update or verify the Medieval Origins mod version.
Check the mod's issue tracker for similar warnings.

description: Detected Java version.
solution: Ensure the Java version matches the server or modpack requirements.
causes: Not yet added...
troubleshooting: Not yet added...

description: Detected Minecraft version from logs.
solution: Ensure mods are compatible with this version.
causes: Not yet added...
troubleshooting: Not yet added...

description: A required mod, (${missing_mod}), is missing from the server configuration.
solution: Ensure the mod (${missing_mod}) is installed and loaded.
causes: The required mod is not present in the `mods/` folder.
The mod version is incompatible with the server version.
examples: [ERROR]: Missing required mod: Just Enough Items (JEI)
troubleshooting: Check the `mods/` folder to ensure the mod is installed.
Ensure the mod version is compatible with the server and other mods.
Download the missing mod from a trusted source (e.g., CurseForge).

description: A required class (${class}) could not be found, likely due to a missing or incompatible mod.
solution: Ensure all mods are installed and compatible with the current Forge version. Check if the required mod is missing or outdated.
causes: A mod dependency is missing.
The mod is not compatible with the Minecraft or Forge version.
The mod file is corrupted.
troubleshooting: Check the mod's documentation for required dependencies.
Ensure all mods are compatible with the Minecraft and Forge versions.
Re-download the mod files and verify their integrity.

description: A mixin class (${class}) required by a mod is missing, indicating a compatibility or configuration issue.
solution: Check if the mod and its dependencies are compatible with the current Forge and Minecraft versions.
causes: A required mod is missing or outdated.
The mod version is incompatible with the Minecraft version.
A configuration issue in the mod.
troubleshooting: Verify that all required mods are installed and up-to-date.
Check the mod's documentation for compatibility notes.
Disable the mod temporarily to identify conflicts.

pattern: Reference map '(?<file>[a-zA-Z0-9.-]+)' for (?<mixin>[a-zA-Z0-9.-]+) could not be read
description: The reference map file (${file}) for a mod mixin (${mixin}) could not be loaded.
solution: Ensure the mod is installed correctly and compatible with the current Forge version. Re-download the mod if necessary.
causes: The reference map file is missing or corrupted.
The mod is not compatible with the Minecraft version.
A dependency for the mod is missing.
examples: Reference map 'handcrafted-forge-1.20.1-forge-refmap.json' for handcrafted.mixins.json could not be read
troubleshooting: Check if the required dependencies for the mod are installed.
Re-download and replace the mod file.
Verify the mod's compatibility with the Forge and Minecraft versions.

pattern: Attempted to select two dependency jars from JarJar which have the same identification
description: Two dependency JAR files have the same identifier, causing a conflict.
solution: Remove one of the conflicting JAR files or check for mod updates to resolve the conflict.
causes: Duplicate mod files in the mods folder.
Conflicting dependencies from different mods.
examples: Attempted to select two dependency jars from JarJar which have the same identification
troubleshooting: Check the mods folder for duplicate files and remove them.
Update all mods to their latest versions.
Test with a minimal set of mods to isolate the issue.

description: One or more required mods are missing, preventing the server from starting.
solution: Install the missing mods as listed in the logs and ensure all dependencies are satisfied.
causes: The mod is not present in the mods folder.
The mod is incompatible with the Forge version.
troubleshooting: Check the mod's documentation for dependencies.
Download and add the missing mods to the mods folder.
Ensure all mods are compatible with the Minecraft and Forge versions.

description: The game or a mod is attempting to load a missing font file, causing a crash.
solution: Ensure the required font file is present in the mod's assets folder or reinstall the mod to recover missing resources.
causes: Corrupted or incomplete mod installation.
The required font file was removed or misplaced.
troubleshooting: Verify that the font file (e.g., inter-medium.ttf) is present in the mod's resource directory.
Re-download and reinstall the mod to ensure all resources are intact.
Check if the mod is compatible with the current Minecraft and Forge versions.

description: The Connector mod is installed and might be causing compatibility issues.
solution: Verify the issue with the Connector mod's issue tracker and temporarily remove it to test for conflicts.
causes: Compatibility issues between Connector and other mods.
Unexpected behavior introduced by the Connector mod.
examples: Please verify issues are not caused by Connector before reporting them to mod authors.
troubleshooting: Disable the Connector mod and test if the issue persists.
Review the Connector mod's issue tracker for similar problems and potential fixes.
Ensure all mods are updated to their latest compatible versions.

description: The Axiom mod encountered a Java-related error during initialization.
solution: Check the required Java version for the mod. Axiom may not be fully compatible with Java 17.
causes: Running the mod on an unsupported Java version (e.g., 17 instead of 8).
Corrupted Axiom mod files or incompatible Forge/Minecraft versions.
troubleshooting: Verify the required Java version for the mod (often Java 8 or 11).
Switch to the appropriate Java version and restart the server.
Ensure the Axiom mod is compatible with the current Minecraft version.

description: A crash occurred in the ModLauncher during initialization, likely caused by a mod conflict or incomplete installation.
solution: Check the mod list for compatibility issues and remove problematic mods.
causes: Incompatible mods loaded together.
Mod dependencies are missing or outdated.
troubleshooting: Review the list of installed mods and their versions for conflicts.
Ensure all mods are compatible with the current Minecraft and Forge versions.
Temporarily remove suspect mods to identify the source of the crash.

description: Axiom mod failed to load the specified font during initialization.
solution: Ensure the font file is present and reinstall the mod if necessary, Check for ATI/AMD GPU driver updates
causes: Missing or misplaced font file in the mod's resources.
Corrupted mod files or incompatible Forge version.
troubleshooting: Ensure your graphics drivers are up to date
Check for missing font files in the mod's directory.
Reinstall the mod to ensure all files are intact.
Verify the mod's compatibility with your Forge and Minecraft versions.

description: A mod failed to load due to missing or invalid signature, or compatibility issues.
solution: Ensure the mod is downloaded from a trusted source, and verify its compatibility with the Forge and Minecraft versions.
causes: The mod is corrupted or tampered with.
The mod does not support the current Forge or Minecraft version.
Missing required dependencies for the mod.
troubleshooting: Re-download the mod from its official source.
Ensure the mod's version matches the current Forge and Minecraft versions.
Check for missing dependencies listed on the mod's documentation page.
Look for alternative versions or updates that might address the issue.

description: A mod encountered an error during loading, potentially due to missing or invalid signatures, or compatibility issues.
solution: Verify the mod's source, ensure compatibility with the current Forge and Minecraft versions, and check for dependencies.
causes: The mod is corrupted or tampered with.
The mod is incompatible with the current Forge or Minecraft version.
The mod lacks a valid signature.
Required dependencies for the mod are missing.
troubleshooting: Re-download the mod from an official or trusted source.
Ensure all required dependencies are installed.
Check compatibility with your current Forge and Minecraft versions.
Look for updates or alternative versions of the mod.
Disable the problematic mod to test if the error resolves.

pattern: SINYTRA CONNECTOR IS PRESENT!.*?Please verify issues are not caused by Connector before reporting them to mod authors\.
description: The Sinytra Connector mod is installed and might interfere with other mods.
solution: Check if the issue persists without the Sinytra Connector mod. If it does, report it on the Sinytra Connector issue tracker.
causes: Compatibility issues between Sinytra Connector and other mods.
Unexpected behavior introduced by the Sinytra Connector mod.
examples: Please verify issues are not caused by Connector before reporting them to mod authors.
troubleshooting: Disable the Sinytra Connector mod and check if the issue persists.
Review the Sinytra Connector mod issue tracker for related reports.
Update the mod to the latest version to resolve potential conflicts.

description: A critical error occurred during mixin transformation.
solution: This error is often caused by incompatible mods. Check the mods listed in the crash log and remove or update any potentially conflicting mods.
causes: Conflicting mods during the mixin transformation process.
Outdated or incompatible mod versions.
troubleshooting: Check the crash log for the affected mods and update them to the latest versions.
Remove any mods that are not compatible with the current Minecraft version.

description: Mixin application failed during transformation.
solution: Check if the affected mod is compatible with the installed Minecraft and Forge/Fabric versions. Update or remove the conflicting mod.
causes: Mod incompatibility with the current version of Minecraft.
Missing or outdated dependencies for the affected mod.
troubleshooting: Verify if the mod causing the error is compatible with the Minecraft version.
Ensure all required dependencies for the mod are installed and up-to-date.

description: The Embeddium instance is being affected by the Oculus mod or others.
solution: Try removing Oculus or other listed mods and see if the issue persists. Update mods to compatible versions.
causes: The Oculus mod is incompatible with other installed mods.
Outdated or conflicting mod versions are causing issues with Embeddium.
troubleshooting: Remove or update the Oculus mod to resolve compatibility issues.
Review the crash logs for other conflicting mods and update them.

description: An InvalidMixinException occurred during mixin transformation involving '${mod1}' and '${mod2}'.
solution: Check for missing or outdated dependencies for '${mod1}' and '${mod2}'. Ensure they are compatible with the current Minecraft, Forge, or Fabric versions.
causes: The mod '${mod1}' is incompatible with the mod '${mod2}'.
Missing or corrupted dependencies required by one or both mods.
Incompatibility with the installed Forge or Fabric version.
examples: org.spongepowered.asm.mixin.transformer.throwables.InvalidMixinException: Unexpecteded ClassMetadataNotFoundException whilst transforming the mixin class: [MAIN Applicator Phase -> mixins.oculus.compat.dh.json:NonCullingFrustumMixin from mod oculus -> Apply Methods -> (IILcom/seibel/distanthorizons/coreapi/util/math/Mat4f;)V:update -> Transform Descriptor -> desc=Lcom/seibel/distanthorizons/coreapi/util/math/Mat4f;]
troubleshooting: Ensure all dependencies for '${mod1}' and '${mod2}' are installed and compatible.
Update '${mod1}' and '${mod2}' to their latest versions to fix potential compatibility issues.
Check the mods' issue trackers or support pages for known problems and fixes.
Remove one of the conflicting mods (e.g., '${mod1}' or '${mod2}') if compatibility cannot be resolved.

description: A block referenced in the mod or configuration is missing.
solution: Ensure the mod providing the block '${block}' is installed and compatible with your Minecraft version.
causes: The block '${block}' is not defined in the mod or configuration.
The mod providing the block is missing or outdated.
troubleshooting: Verify the mod providing '${block}' is installed and up-to-date.
Check for typos in the configuration files referencing '${block}'.

description: A mod or plugin file is corrupted.

File transfer errors during upload/download.

description: A required mod is missing.

The mod's version is incompatible with the Minecraft version.
troubleshooting: Verify the required mod's presence in the mods folder.
Download and install the correct version of the mod from a trusted source.

description: The server ran out of memory due to excessive garbage collection.
solution: Increase the allocated RAM for the server or optimize server performance.
causes: Insufficient memory allocation for the server.
Excessive entity count or plugins causing high memory usage.
troubleshooting: Allocate more RAM in the server startup settings.
Identify and remove resource-heavy mods/plugins.

description: The server's storage is full, preventing operations from completing.
solution: Free up disk space or increase the storage capacity.
causes: Insufficient storage on the server.
Excessive log or crash report files.
examples: java.io.IOException: No space left on device
troubleshooting: Delete unnecessary files (e.g., logs, crash reports) to free up space.
Increase the allocated storage for the server.

pattern: Mod file .* is missing mods\.toml file
description: A mod file is missing the required mods.toml descriptor, preventing it from loading.
solution: Re-download or update the affected mod and ensure compatibility with the Forge and Minecraft versions.
causes: The mod file is corrupted or incomplete.
The mod is not compatible with the current Forge or Minecraft version.
examples: Mod file C:\Users\krist\curseforge\minecraft\Install\libraries\net\minecraftforge\fmlcore\1.20.1-47.3.0\fmlcore-1.20.1-47.3.0.jar is missing mods.toml file
troubleshooting: Re-download the mod from a trusted source.
Ensure the mod is compatible with your Forge and Minecraft versions.
Check for updates or alternative versions of the mod.

description: A required class for a mod or mixin could not be found.
solution: Verify that all dependencies are installed and the mod is compatible with the Minecraft version.
causes: The mod's dependencies are missing or not installed correctly.
The mod is incompatible with the Minecraft or Forge version.
The mod file is corrupted.
troubleshooting: Ensure all mod dependencies are installed and match the Minecraft version.
Update or reinstall the mod from a trusted source.
Check the mod's documentation for compatibility notes.

description: A mixin is targeting a class that does not exist, likely due to a missing or incompatible mod.
solution: Ensure all required mods are installed and up to date. Check for mod compatibility.
causes: The mixin's target class does not exist in the current mod environment.
The mod or its dependencies are missing or outdated.
Incompatible Forge or Fabric versions.
troubleshooting: Verify that all required mods are installed and compatible.
Update mods and dependencies to their latest versions.
Check the mod's issue tracker for similar problems.

pattern: Shift\.BY=.+ exceeds the maximum allowed value: .+
description: A mixin shift value exceeds the maximum allowed, causing potential instability.
solution: Increase the maximum shift value in the mixin configuration or contact the mod author for a fix.
causes: The mixin's shift value is incorrectly set or exceeds allowed limits.
A misconfiguration in the mod's mixin file.
examples: @Inject(@At("INVOKE")) Shift.BY=1 on crittersandcompanions.mixins.json:LivingEntityMixin::handler$caa000$onDie exceeds the maximum allowed value: 0.
troubleshooting: Increase the maximum shift value in the mixin configuration file.
Contact the mod author for support or updates.
Verify the mixin file for syntax or configuration errors.

description: Indicates the Java version being used for the mod loader.
solution: Ensure the required Java version is installed and matches the mod loader's compatibility.
causes: The Java version being used does not match the mod loader's requirements.
Incompatible mod loader or configuration.
troubleshooting: Verify the required Java version for the mod loader.
Install or switch to the correct Java version.
Check mod loader documentation for compatibility requirements.

description: FoamFix attempted to optimize or patch Minecraft classes and encountered an issue.
solution: 1. Client-Side: Edit FoamFix's configuration file (`config/foamfix.cfg`) and set `optimizedBlockPos=false`, 2. If this is located on your server, remove it.
causes: FoamFix optimization causing class transformation errors.
Incompatibility with certain mods or configurations.
troubleshooting: Modify FoamFix configuration to disable problematic optimizations.
Replace FoamFix with a newer or alternative mod.
If this is located on a server your running, remove FoamFix.

pattern: Re-entrant transformer '.*' was detected and will no longer process meta class data
description: A re-entrant transformer was detected, which can indicate mod conflicts or incompatibility.
solution: Identify and update the mod associated with the transformer. Temporarily disable the mod to test for conflicts.
causes: Conflicting mods using the same transformer.
Broken or outdated mod transformer.
examples: A re-entrant transformer '$wrapper.svenhjol.charm.base.CharmClassTransformer' was detected and will no longer process meta class data
troubleshooting: Disable mods incrementally to identify the problematic one.
Update or replace the mod with a newer version.

description: The class `mekanism.client.render.entity.RenderFlame` could not be found, indicating an issue with the Mekanism mod.
solution: Ensure the Mekanism mod is correctly installed and compatible with the Forge and Minecraft versions.
causes: Missing Mekanism mod files.
Incompatible version of Mekanism with Forge or Minecraft.
troubleshooting: Reinstall the Mekanism mod.
Update Mekanism to a version compatible with your Forge and Minecraft setup.

description: Duplicate mod files detected in the 'mods' folder. This can cause conflicts and prevent Minecraft from starting.
solution: Check the 'mods' folder and remove any duplicate mod files. Keep only one version of each mod.
causes: Multiple versions of the same mod are present in the 'mods' folder.
Accidentally copying mod files multiple times.
Mod manager or installation tool creating duplicates.
examples: Found mod file BiomesOPlenty-1.20.1-18.0.0.592.jar of type MOD
Found mod file BiomesOPlenty-1.20.1-18.0.0.592 - Kopie.jar of type MOD
troubleshooting: Open the 'mods' folder and sort files by name to locate duplicates.
Delete older or extra versions of each mod, keeping only one.
Restart Minecraft to ensure the issue is resolved.

description: This error occurs when a mod is unable to find a required Sodium class, indicating a compatibility issue or missing dependency.
solution: Verify mod compatibility and ensure Sodium is correctly installed. If using Optifine, remove it as it conflicts with Sodium.
causes: Optifine is installed alongside Sodium, causing conflicts.
Incorrect modloader (e.g., Forge instead of Fabric).
Missing or corrupted Sodium files.
Dependency conflict with other mods modifying the rendering pipeline.
Check for other performance mods that might conflict (e.g., Optifine or Rubidium).
troubleshooting: Remove either Optifine or Sodium from the mods folder.
Ensure you are using the correct modloader for Sodium (Fabric).
Check for missing or outdated dependencies for Sodium.
Use an alternative shader mod like Iris if shaders are needed with Sodium.

pattern: Pack \".*\" is not valid! Can't load it\.
description: The specified shader pack could not be loaded.
solution: Ensure the shader pack is compatible with your modpack and installed version of Forge.
causes: Corrupted shader pack file.
Incompatible shader version with Forge or mods.
Missing or incorrect configuration.
examples: Pack "ComplementaryReimagined_r1.0.zip" is not valid! Can't load it.
troubleshooting: Download the latest version of the shader pack.
Verify compatibility with the current Forge version.
Ensure proper configuration in the shader settings.

description: This error occurs when the 'Copycat' mod's required classes are missing, preventing the game from loading properly.
solution: Ensure that the 'Copycat' mod is installed and compatible with the current version of Minecraft and Forge. Verify that all dependencies for the 'Copycat' mod are present.
causes: The 'Copycat' mod is missing from the mods folder.
The 'Copycat' mod version is incompatible with the Minecraft or Forge version.
A corrupted or incomplete installation of the 'Copycat' mod.
troubleshooting: Check the mods folder to confirm the 'Copycat' mod is present.
Download the latest version of the 'Copycat' mod compatible with the current Forge and Minecraft versions.
Verify the integrity of the 'Copycat' mod file and re-download it if corrupted.
Check the 'create_connected' mod documentation for any specific dependencies or requirements related to the 'Copycat' mod.

description: This error occurs when a required sound file for the Northstar mod is missing, which may lead to incomplete or silent audio effects.
solution: Check the mod installation for missing or corrupted sound files. Reinstall the mod if necessary.
causes: The sound file is missing from the mod's assets folder.
An incomplete or corrupted mod installation.
The mod version is incompatible with the current Minecraft or Forge version.
troubleshooting: Verify the integrity of the Northstar mod files in the mods folder.
Download and reinstall the latest compatible version of the Northstar mod.
Check for mod dependencies or conflicts that might affect asset loading.

description: This error occurs when a required model file for the VS Clockwork mod is missing or contains invalid JSON data.
solution: Check the mod installation for missing or corrupted model files. Verify that the JSON files in the mod folder are properly formatted.
causes: The model file is missing from the mod's assets folder.
The JSON file for the model is corrupted or empty.
An incomplete or corrupted mod installation.
troubleshooting: Verify the integrity of the VS Clockwork mod files in the mods folder.
Open the model JSON file to ensure it is not empty or corrupted.
Reinstall the mod from a trusted source to ensure all assets are included.

description: This error occurs when the specified .jar file for the server or mod is missing.
solution: Ensure the .jar file exists and is correctly named.
causes: The .jar file was deleted or moved.
Incorrect file path or name in the startup script.
Corrupt or incomplete server/mod installation.
examples: java.io.FileNotFoundException: server.jar (No such file or directory)
troubleshooting: Verify the file name and path in the server startup script.
Check if the .jar file is present in the server directory.
Re-download or re-install the missing file.

description: This error occurs when a plugin uses an API version unsupported by the server.
solution: Update the plugin or downgrade the server version.
causes: The plugin is designed for a newer server version.
Server version is incompatible with the plugin.
troubleshooting: Download and install a version of the plugin compatible with the server.
Upgrade or downgrade the server to match the plugin's requirements.
Consider alternative plugins compatible with the current server version.

description: Two or more mods are conflicting by attempting to modify the same method or constant.
solution: Disable one of the conflicting mods or look for compatibility patches.
causes: Multiple mods modifying the same part of the game's code.
Mods using the same mixin targets.
troubleshooting: Identify and disable conflicting mods.
Check for compatibility patches or updates.
Report the conflict to the mod developers.

pattern: Workarounds applied to prevent crashes or other issues on your system: \[.*\]
description: Graphics driver optimizations or workarounds have been applied.
solution: Update your graphics drivers and ensure compatibility with the mod setup.
causes: Outdated graphics drivers.
Incompatibilities with certain rendering features.
examples: [27Dec2024 16:47:57.473] [main/WARN] [Embeddium-Workarounds/]: Workarounds applied to prevent crashes or other issues on your system: [NVIDIA_THREADED_OPTIMIZATIONS]
troubleshooting: Update your graphics drivers to the latest version.
Adjust graphics settings or disable specific mods that impact rendering.
None given at this time

description: The access token is hidden for security purposes.
solution: This is a normal security measure to prevent leaking sensitive information such as user authentication tokens. No action is required unless you encounter authentication issues.
causes: The access token is redacted intentionally to protect sensitive data.
An authentication issue may occur if the token is invalid.
troubleshooting: If experiencing authentication issues, ensure your account is logged in correctly.
Verify the launcher is connected to the correct Microsoft or Mojang account.
Re-login to your Minecraft account to refresh the access token.
None given at this time
